results.firPara: The Portugueses frills and jinks are long dead. Xherdan Shaqiri keeps losing the ball. And Englands presence high up on the dribble list shows how the basic idea of one has changed
results.secPara: The Portugueses frills and jinks are long dead. Xherdan Shaqiri keeps losing the ball. And Englands presence high up on the dribble list shows how the basic idea of one has changed
results.webTitle: Cristiano Ronaldo has lost his dribble – and he’s not alone at Euro 2016 | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: When Granit Xhaka completed his £35m move to Arsenal from Borussia Mönchengladbach at the end of May, Gary Lineker, a noted opinion-shaper on Twitter, spotted an opportunity. Will Arsenals new signing turn them into title contenders? the former England captain wrote. Well, if anyone can, Xhaka can …
results.secPara: The Match of the Day presenter has become quite the wordsmith, as anybody who listened to his speech in honour of Jamie Vardy at the Football Writers Associations Player of the Year dinner will attest. That was a beautifully constructed piece and here he raised a smile and a few funk moves with his reference to Chaka Khan and her 1984 hit I Feel for You.
results.webTitle: Granit Xhaka steps up to become Switzerland’s talisman at Euro 2016

results.firPara: In the court of public opinion Roy Hodgsons England have been widely condemned as a possession-heavy, tireless but ultimately toothless force so far at Euro 2016. Given that previous incarnations of the national team at major tournaments have been prone to treating the ball like an unpinned hand-grenade, it seems odd that this latest version is being picked on for having finally worked out how to hang on to the thing. Its the kind of criticism that was flung at Spain in 2012 until Vicente del Bosques side went on and won the European Championship. Again. But thats not to say England will follow suit. Far from it. There is a legitimate concern to be found if you pick apart the carping.
results.secPara: Perhaps one player more than any other is emblematic of the problem afflicting new England Adam Lallana, an incredibly adept technical footballer with endless energy whom many would argue has been among Hodgsons better performers in the group stages. In the Guardians ratings, only Eric Dier rates higher than him in scores for England players who have appeared in all three games. Lallana seems to have received more of the ball in his three Euro 2016 appearances to date than he did in his 23 England caps preceding them. He has been a magnet for it. Its no surprise then that he is of Spanish descent. His incredible pressing and willingness to take the ball where there appears to be no space and perform bendy escape acts to keep possession are qualities more often appreciated in Iberia.
results.webTitle: Adam Lallana: tricky, tireless and tidy but where is the end product?

results.firPara: Liverpool have been offered encouraging signs in their quest to sign Sadio Mané from Southampton with the Senegal forward hoping to join Jürgen Klopps side for around £30m.
results.secPara: Mané, a product of the Metz academy who moved to St Marys in 2014 for around £12m, has emerged as a main transfer target for Liverpool despite continued interest in Bayern Munichs Mario Götze.
results.webTitle: Liverpool closing in on signing of Sadio Mané from Southampton for £30m

results.firPara: Got a minute? Digest the best of our Euro 2016 coverage on the eve of the knockout stage as we also look at the best players in France so far
results.webTitle: The Euro 2016 minute: bring on the last 16

results.firPara: The West Coasts two biggest teams are in need of a boost while Philadelphia Union have a goalscorer in fine form
results.secPara: The West Coasts two biggest teams are in need of a boost while Philadelphia Union have a goalscorer in fine form
results.webTitle: MLS weekend preview: Dempsey-less Seattle need to get going against NYC FC

results.firPara: After three unconvincing displays in the group stage, Roy Hodgson appears no closer to finding his best XI. Our writers select their choices to take on Iceland
results.secPara: This is the team that started the second half of the Wales match when Roy Hodgson talked afterwards about Harry Kane having shown signs of wear and tear. Players dont shake off fatigue easily so I would favour Daniel Sturridge and Jamie Vardy. The lack of wingers isnt ideal but Hodgson has made it clear Kyle Walker and Danny Rose supply the width these days. Wayne Rooney and Dele Alli would return to midfield whereas Adam Lallana can consider himself fortunate to keep his place. Daniel Taylor
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: which players should start for England against Iceland in last-16 tie?

results.firPara: Tottenham Hotspur have had a €14m (£10.7m) offer rejected by Alkmaar for the striker Vincent Janssen, with the Dutch club holding out for €20m.
results.secPara: Mauricio Pochettino is keen to add to his limited options up front and the Tottenham manager made a personal check on Janssen at the end of last month, when he watched him play for Holland against the Republic of Ireland in Dublin.
results.webTitle: Spurs’ €14m offer for striker Vincent Janssen rejected by Alkmaar

results.firPara: With the tournament having reached its halfway stage we pick our best and worst XI based on the individual player ratings from each game
results.secPara: Euro 2016 has reached the halfway stage and although the group stage did not produce a standout team, there were some standout individual performances.
results.webTitle: The Guardian’s Euro 2016 team of the tournament so far

results.firPara: The Mill is too depressed for the banter, so lets proceed straight to the news that Juventus want Alexis Sánchez to replace Álvaro Morata, who is leaving for Real Madrid, or Chelsea, or Arsenal, or somewhere.
results.secPara: For years, Arsène Wenger has been accused of buying too many playmakers. Now hes discovered the joy of playbreakers in addition to Francis Coquelin, Granit Xhaka and Mohamed Elneny, he wants to sign Duracell bunny NGolo Kanté from Leicester.
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Arsenal’s Alexis Sánchez to Juventus?
